author: {'steamid': '76561198052902379', 'num_games_owned': 353, 'num_reviews': 253, 'playtime_forever': 19, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 19, 'last_played': 1649730032}
review: Avoid this game, it has no sense of pacing to the story combined with horrendous platforming and enemy movement. Tries to cover the bad mechanics with a novel plot, but the difficulty of everything about it ruins this. Needs better understanding of the fundamentals.

author: {'steamid': '76561198051583955', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 200, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 186, 'last_played': 1601815900}
review:
Pretty good western-themed platform game, sporting some very nice Atari 2600 retro-graphics (along with matching SFX) & an old tv-screen filter.  Definitely not easy, but that's part of its charm, I guess.  

I played this several months ago and recently decided to come back and play again;  unfortunately, my old save was gone - probably due to an update (incompatibility issue) - so I'm going to have to start over, which is unfortunate - but not a big deal really...

review: Ciekawa gra w stylu pixelowym, ale chyba jestem za s≈Çaby, bo utknƒÖ≈Çem w pewnym momencie (trochƒô za g≈Ço≈õna). Pzdro eelo

author: {'steamid': '76561197964352654', 'num_games_owned': 3110, 'num_reviews': 93, 'playtime_forever': 38, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 38, 'last_played': 1590449127}
review:
An interesting western themed platformer with a slight horror tilt. Something definitely feels off about this world the developers have created, but unfortunately the game has not been finished so you don't really get any insight as to what it is. Still, it was a very stylized and interesting romp. I'd definitely look forward to a full game if it ever does come about.

Gameplay wise, I wouldn't call it amazing, but it wasn't bad. It's mostly some tricky platforming and a few enemies to shoot. The checkpoint system could use some work. The story and atmosphere is definitely the selling point to Too Loud, it's just a pity we haven't gotten to see more yet.

author: {'steamid': '76561198082190090', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 32, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 32, 'last_played': 1564896914}
review:
I played a bit of this game: https://youtu.be/tPlN1YoN2yE 

I enjoy the style of this game. I also enjoy that it's a nice sidescrolling platformer, mixed with some simple shooting. Although, I did have issues with creatures respawning and it not being established beforehand. Just a minor complaint to be honest, and I had no issues beyond that. I do complain a bit about how a tree kills me, because it makes no sense, but it teaches what is dangerous and whats not, so I understand. Platforming is difficult in some ways, but doesn't feel super unfair.
